comments:
When running Eclipse with IBM JDK 5.0SR1 I often get the following exception. When target JVM stops at a breakpoint I see CPU utilization 100% for about a minute then my Eclipse either closes silently or shows "OutOfMemory" dialog first and closes after that. I have not seen this problem with SUN JDK 1.5.0_06.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-04-19 17:00:18.746
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Computing hasChildren".
!STACK 0
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Failed to fork OS thread
	at java.lang.Thread.startImpl(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Thread.start(Thread.java:963)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.WorkerPool.jobQueued(WorkerPool.java:140)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.schedule(JobManager.java:949)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.InternalJob.schedule(InternalJob.java:349)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs.Job.schedule(Job.java:421)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.AsynchronousRequestMonitor.done(AsynchronousRequestMonitor.java:127)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.provisional.AsynchronousContentAdapter.computeIsContainer(AsynchronousContentAdapter.java:105)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.provisional.AsynchronousContentAdapter$2.run(AsynchronousContentAdapter.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)



I am running WinXP SP2, Eclipse 3.2 I20060413-1718, I start Eclipse with "-vmargs -Xmx1024M"


java -version says

java version "1.5.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pwi32dev-20060222a (SR1))
IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223-20060222a (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20060220_05389_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20060220_2133_r8
GC   - 20060214_AA)
JCL  - 20060222a

Created an attachment (id=39004)
zipped javacore file

This looks like some sort of concurrency issue. Attached javacore file which I took while Eclipse was using 100% CPU, shows 1300+ worker threads apparently trying to update VariablesView. I was also able to reproduce the problem with SUN JVM, so it is not specific IBM Java5.

I believe LaunchViewer kept redrawing if suspended thread's stake frames were not visible.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 120200 ***
